io.sphere.sdk.meta

Class ContributorDocumentation

  • java.lang.Object
    • io.sphere.sdk.meta.ContributorDocumentation

  • public final class ContributorDocumentation
extends java.lang.Object

    Developing the SDK

    • please follow the Contribution Guidelines
    • `sbt clean genDoc` creates Javadocs for all modules, it is available in target/javaunidoc/index.html
    • opening the project with IntelliJ IDEA Ultimate might not work due to a bug, but using this solution works

    Construction

    • A good class should have at least one explicit constructor.
    • If multiple constructors are present, one constructor should have the role as primary constructor, so every other constructor has to directly or indirectly call the primary constructor.
    • Prefer to create non-public constructors.
    • The purpose of a constructor is to create a usable and consistent object, but not to fire actions. Prefer public static factory methods to constructors so that internals are hidden and to make it possible to turn the class into an interface later.
    • Static factory methods should be named of, to be compliant to the Java 8 style, for instance Optional.of(Object). It is okay to create additional aliases, like empty() for of(). Very specific factory methods can be named like this: Xyz.ofSlug(final String slug) or this: Xyz.ofName(final String name). This naming convention makes clear what parameter type is required for the method compared to the more general method name like: Xyz.of(final String guessWhat).
    • If several constructors are present use the annotation JsonCreator to mark the right one for the JSON deserialization.
      • If you don't do it you'll get an error message like Caused by: com.fasterxml.jackson.databind.JsonMappingException: Conflicting property-based creators: already had [constructor for YOUR_CLASS, annotations: [null]], encountered [constructor for YOUR_CLASS, annotations: [null]]
      • Another reason for the previous error can be a static factory method which jackson tries to use for mapping by mistake, so you better annotate it with JsonIgnore.
      • Also the error message java.lang.RuntimeException: com.fasterxml.jackson.databind.JsonMappingException: Could not find creator property with name 'YOUR_PROPERTY_NAME' indicates that you should annotate a factory method with JsonIgnore.
    • In classic Jackson JSON projects you have to annotate the arguments for a constructor: 
      @JsonCreator
public Xyz(@JsonProperty("id") String id)
      but with Java 8 it can be just 
      @JsonCreator
public Xyz(final String id)

    Classes

    • Do not extend Object directly; if you can't find a base class simply use Base which implements equals, hashCode and toString with reflection.

    Polymorphism/Abstract Classes/Interfaces

    • If you have to deserialize abstract classes or interfaces you need to specify the way how Jackson does the deserialization. Have a look into the source code of ProductDiscountValue to find out how this can be done.
    • If you use JsonTypeInfo with a property and you have already declared a property with the same name, it will may be written twice with different values, see also Stackoverflow.

    Optional values

    • In contrast to classic Jackson projects you can use Optional<MyType> directly as member/getter/constructor parameter and it will be mapped.
    • Sometimes lists/sets are optional in the API, so if you may send an empty JSON array like in 
      {
  "key" : "assignPricesToMasterVariantAccordingToAChannel",
  "roles" : [ ],
  "name" : null,
  "description" : null
}
      it returns the following error message: 
      {
  "statusCode" : 400,
  "message" : "'roles' should not be empty.",
  "errors" : [ {
    "code" : "InvalidOperation",
    "message" : "'roles' should not be empty."
  } ]
}

      To solve this problem you have to prevent the field from serialization like in

      {
  "key" : "assignPricesToMasterVariantAccordingToAChannel",
  "name" : null,
  "description" : null
}

      This can be achieved by adding the annotation JsonInclude like this: @JsonInclude(JsonInclude.Include.NON_EMPTY)

    Creating aggregates

    Package io.sphere.sdk.<RESOURCE_AS_LOWERCASE_IN_PLURAL>

    • create an interface RESOURCE which extends DefaultModel with RESOURCE as type parameter
    • create a class RESOURCEImpl which extends DefaultModelImpl with RESOURCE as type argument and it should implement RESOURCE
    • in RESOURCEImpl replace "public class" with "class" to set the visibility of this class to package scope
    • in RESOURCEImpl add private final fields for all members of the resource (except the members defined in DefaultModelImpl like DefaultModelViewImpl.id, DefaultModelViewImpl.version, DefaultModelViewImpl.createdAt and DefaultModelViewImpl.lastModifiedAt
    • in RESOURCEImpl create a constructor with your IDE, this will be called the primary constructor
    • in RESOURCEImpl create getters for all the fields you have created with your IDE
    • in RESOURCEImpl use 'extract interface' of your IDE to get the signatures of the getters, cut and paste them into RESOURCE and remove the extracted interface, as a result the getter will also have the Override annotation
    • in RESOURCE annotate the interface RESOURCE with @JsonDeserialize(as=RESOURCEImpl.class)
    • in RESOURCE create a static method which returns the type id as in Category.typeId()
    • in RESOURCE create a static method which returns a TypeReference as in Category.typeReference()
    • in RESOURCE implement Referenceable.toReference() as in io.sphere.sdk.categories.Category#toReference()
    • create a class RESOURCEBuilder which extends DefaultModelFluentBuilder<RESOURCEBuilder, RESOURCE>
    • in RESOURCEBuilder copy the attributes of RESOURCEImpl and make them non final
    • in RESOURCEBuilder make a private constructor with all really necessary values
    • in RESOURCEBuilder set default values where you can, for Optional empty and for list or set their empty versions.
    • in RESOURCEBuilder create public static "of" methods which constructs the builder in a consistent way
    • create a RESOURCEImplTest which extends DefaultModelSubclassTest<RESOURCE>, you need to implement some methods.

    • Method Summary

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait
